title: Police investigating gunshot wound to 2-year-old in Trenton
content:
TRENTON -- City police are investigating how a 2-year-old boy was shot in the hand inside a North Trenton home Monday morning, police said.
The department was notified of the incident by Capital Health Regional Medical Center in Trenton, where the boy was taken for treatment, police said.
The department received the call at about 11:20 a.m., police said.
The toddler had a non life-threatening wound to a finger, police said. The incident occurred in a home in the 600 block of Southard Street.
Police spokesman Lt. Rolando Ramos said Monday evening the department was still trying to determine exactly how the child was wounded.
The incident occurred a day after police responded to 3 separate shootings in the city in which 66 shots were fired and one man was wounded.
